reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying four nights at Villa Clara, and found it a real gem in Beirut. The villa is located in Mar Mikhael - at walking distance from a lot of restaurants/bars and about 15 mins Gemmayze. With a taxi it is about 10 mins to downtown.
reviews.title: Very charming hotel/B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very clean, and nicely decorated with a personal touch - if you are staying here you won't feel that you are in an anonymous room of a large chain. Also worth mentioning is the superb quality of the bed. The restaurant is based on the ground-floor and if you want to you can have dinner there every night, perfect french kitchen. Breakfast is also served in the restaurant or in the garden, do not expect a large buffet, but the morning-chef brings you a very nice Lebanese style breakfast.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Villa Clara for a week-end get away in Beirut. The villa is extraordinarily gorgeous with perfect decorative details, rendering each space and room distinct. Most beautiful is the restaurant, not only the space, paintings, layout and furnishing itself, but the creative and simply fantastic menu. Marie Helene and Patrick are perfect hosts and so helpful with navigating the neighborhood, city and trips outside of Beirut. Patrick is a wonderful chef, producing delicious, organic and creative dishes and Marie Helene is an insightful and brilliant resource for all that is Beirut, culture, and going out. We cannot wait to be back!
reviews.title: Great experience!!!!
